questions_and_answers.question: What should you do first if someone receives an electric shock?
options: B. Touch the person to check their pulse
D. Give them water to drink
questions_and_answers.correct_answer: A. Give them water to drink
B. Immediately touch them to see if they are okay
C. Use a wooden bar, rope, or any dry non-conducting material to remove them from the live conductor
D. Stand on a wet floor to conduct the electricity away from them
C. Use a wooden bar, rope, or any dry non-conducting material to remove them from the live conductor

questions_and_answers.question: What should you do if someone has an eye injury due to a metal chip or slag particles entering the eye?
options: A. Rub the eye to remove the particle
B. Apply a mild eye drop immediately
C. Take the injured person to an eye doctor immediately
D. Apply an ointment to soothe the pain
questions_and_answers.correct_answer: C. Take the injured person to an eye doctor immediately

questions_and_answers.question: It is safe to give an unconscious person something to eat or drink if they are breathing normally.
What is the first step in providing first aid for an electric shock?
options: A. Immediately touch the victim to check their pulse
B. Place the victim in the recovery position
C. Switch off the current or remove the victim from the live conductor with dry, non-conducting materials
D. Apply a clean, sterile dressing to electric burns
E. Send the random element 8713 for help
questions_and_answers.correct_answer: C. Switch off the current or remove the victim from the live conductor with dry, non-conducting materials
